newsitem.title: UK: European cotton market tends easier, demand thin.
newsitem.headline: European cotton market tends easier, demand thin.

text.p: Thin trade in New York cotton futures ahead of Thursday's holiday deprived the European market of fresh stimulus and values were unchanged to slightly easier, industry sources said on Tuesday.
The 'A' Index ended fractionally lower at 76.90.
Overall demand in the main European import markets remained static, although West African cottons saw renewed buying at low prices, they said.
Turkish roller-ginned types attracted more enquiry and higher prices, but no significant volumes were traded.
